meanings.definition: A small deer of the genus Mazama, typically having unbranched antlers.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, we spotted a group of brockets grazing peacefully.
meanings.sent2: The brockets moved gracefully through the trees, their unbranched antlers shining in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: Why did the brockets throw a party in the woods? Because they wanted to celebrate their unbranched antlers!
meanings.sent4: The brockets, with their unbranched antlers, stood out like delicate sculptures in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the brockets with their unbranched antlers was etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: The male of various deer, especially the roe deer, in its second year.
meanings.sent1: The brockets were seen roaming the meadow, their youthful energy evident in their movements.
meanings.sent2: Hunters often seek out brockets for their impressive antlers and agile nature.
meanings.sent3: Why did the brockets challenge each other to a race? To prove who was the fastest young deer!
meanings.sent4: The brockets, like young princes of the forest, bounded gracefully through the undergrowth.
meanings.sent5: The playful antics of the brockets brought a smile to everyone watching.
